docs.summary: The Coupons API is used to manage your site's coupons.
description: You can offer your customers discount coupons to promote loyalty and increase
sales. Customers can then apply the coupon codes at checkout to
take advantage of your offers. You can apply coupons to items in
[Wix Stores](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-wix-stores-coupons),
[Wix Bookings](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-discount-coupons-in-wix-bookings),
[Wix Events](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-coupons-in-wix-events), and [Wix Pricing Plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-creating-discount-coupons).
To use the Coupons API, import {coupons} from the `wix-marketing-backend` module:
```javascript
import {coupons} from 'wix-marketing-backend';

params.name: couponInfo
params.doc: The information to use when creating the coupon.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Object containing the ID of the new coupon.

description: The `createCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an object containing the ID of
the new coupon after it has been successfully created.
When creating a coupon, the specified `couponInfo` object must
contain a value for exactly 1 of the following coupon properties. This
defines the coupon type.
+ `"moneyOffAmount"`
+ `"percentOffRate"`
+ `"fixedPriceAmount"`
+ `"buyXGetY"`
+ `"freeShipping"`
When creating a new coupon, the specified `couponInfo` object must
contain values for `name`, `code`, `startTime`, and either `scope` or `minimumSubtotal`.
The exception is for a `freeShipping` coupon type, for which you cannot apply
a `scope` and `minimumSubtotal` is optional.
The coupon scope defines the items a coupon applies to. You can apply a coupon to
all items in a specific Wix application, a group within the application,
or a single item within a group.
The following table lists the currently supported coupon scopes:
| namespace | group | entityId | Result |
| stores | -- | -- | Applies to all store products |
| stores | product | product ID | Applies to the specific store product with the provided ID |
| stores | collection | collection ID | Applies to the specific store collection with the provided ID |
| bookings | -- | -- | Applies to all bookings services |
| bookings | service | service ID | Applies to the specific bookings service with the provided ID |
| events | event | event ID | Applies to the specific event with the provided ID |
| events | ticket | -- | Applies to all event tickets |
| events | ticket | ticket ID | Applies to the specific event ticket with the provided ID |
| pricingPlans | -- | -- | Applies to all pricing plans |
| pricingPlans | plan | plan ID | Applies to the specific pricing plan with the provided ID |

examples.title: Create a new coupon with options
Create a new "money off" coupon
Create a new free shipping coupon
Create a new "buy x, get y" coupon
Create a new coupon that applies to a specific store product
body: "scope": { // Coupon applies to the store product with the specified ID

examples.title: Create a new coupon that applies to all event tickets
body: "scope": { // Coupon applies to all event tickets

examples.title: Create a new "percent off" coupon that applies to all pricing plans
body: "scope": { // Coupon applies to all pricing plans

params.name: couponId
params.doc: ID of the coupon to delete.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the coupon is deleted.

description: The `deleteCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the coupon
is successfully deleted.

examples.title: Delete a coupon
body: // Returns a promise that is resolved when

params.name: couponId
params.doc: ID of the coupon to update.

params.name: couponInfo
params.doc: The information to update the coupon with.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the coupon is updated.

docs.summary: Updates the specified fields of an existing coupon.
description: The `updateCouponFields()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the
coupon is successfully updated.
Only the properties passed in the `CouponInfo` object will
be updated. All other properties will remain the same.
To remove a value from the coupon, pass its corresponding property with a value
of `null`.
When updating a coupon, you cannot change the coupon's type. For example,
if the coupon's type is `moneyOffAmount`, you cannot change it to `fixedPriceAmount`.
You can update the coupon type's value. For example, you can change the
value of `moneyOffAmount` from `5` to `10`.
The coupon scope defines the items a coupon applies to. You can apply a coupon to
all items in a specific Wix application, a group within the application,
or a single item within a group.
The following table lists the currently supported coupon scopes:
| namespace | group | entityId | Result |
| stores | -- | -- | Applies to all store products |
| stores | product | product ID | Applies to the specific store product with the provided ID |
| stores | collection | collection ID | Applies to the specific store collection with the provided ID |
| bookings | -- | -- | Applies to all bookings services |
| bookings | service | service ID | Applies to the specific bookings service with the provided ID |
| events | event | event ID | Applies to the specific event with the provided ID |
| events | ticket | -- | Applies to all event tickets |
| events | ticket | ticket ID | Applies to the specific event ticket with the provided ID |
| pricingPlans | -- | -- | Applies to all pricing plans |
| pricingPlans | plan | plan ID | Applies to the specific pricing plan with the provided ID |

members.name: _id
members.doc: Coupon ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of coupon.

members.name: code
members.doc: Coupon code. Must be unique for all coupons in your site. Maximum 20 characters.

members.name: startTime
members.doc: Coupon valid from.

members.name: expirationTime
members.doc: Coupon expiration time.

members.name: usageLimit
members.doc: Maximum number of times a coupon can be used. Note that multiple purchases by the same customer or purchases by different customers are both counted toward usage limit.

members.name: active
members.doc: Indicates whether the coupon is currently [active](https://support.wix.com/en/article/activating-and-deactivating-coupons-in-wix-stores).

members.name: scope
members.doc: Scope of the coupon. When no scope is defined, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces` in the site.

members.name: _dateCreated
members.doc: Coupon creation date.

members.name: expired
members.doc: Whether the coupon is expired.

members.name: displayData
members.doc: Coupon display data in the dashboard. Returned if the coupon is only valid for a specific product/booking/event.

members.name: type
members.doc: Coupon type. For example, "PercentOff", "FreeShipping", etc.

members.name: limitPerCustomer
members.doc: Maximum number of times the coupon can be used **per customer**.

members.name: limitedToOneItem
members.doc: Indicates whether the coupon is limited to 1 discount per order. If true and a customer pays for multiple items the coupon applies to, only the lowest priced item is discounted. Coupons with a `bookings` `namespace` are always limited to one item.

members.name: minimumSubtotal
members.doc: The coupon is only applicable when the order subtotal is over this amount.

members.name: moneyOffAmount
members.doc: Coupon type: Fixed price discount.

members.name: percentOffRate
members.doc: Coupon type: Discount as a percentage.

members.name: fixedPriceAmount
members.doc: Coupon type: Specific sale price. Currently only supported for coupons with a `stores` `namespace`.

members.name: buyXGetY
members.doc: Coupon type: Free products when making a purchase. `buyXGetY` is an object that specifies `x` and `y` in the following scenario: if a visitor purchases x number of products, they receive y number of products for free. Currently only supported for coupons with a `stores` `namespace`.

members.name: freeShipping
members.doc: Coupon type: Free shipping. If true, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces` in the site.

examples.title: Update a coupon's expiration date
body: // Returns a promise that is resolved when

members.name: expirationTime
members.doc: Coupon expires at this date and time.

members.name: usageLimit
members.doc: Maximum number of times a coupon can be used. Note that multiple purchases by the same customer or purchases by different customers are both counted toward usage limit.

members.name: active
members.doc: Indicates whether the coupon is currently [active](https://support.wix.com/en/article/activating-and-deactivating-coupons-in-wix-stores).

members.name: scope
members.doc: Scope of the coupon. When no scope is defined, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces` in the site.

members.name: _dateCreated
members.doc: Coupon creation date.

members.name: expired
members.doc: Whether the coupon is expired.

members.name: displayData
members.doc: Coupon display data in the dashboard. Returned if the coupon is only valid for a specific product/booking/event.

members.name: type
members.doc: Coupon type. For example, "PercentOff", "FreeShipping", etc.

members.name: limitPerCustomer
members.doc: Maximum number of times the coupon can be used **per customer**. Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: limitedToOneItem
members.doc: Indicates whether the coupon is limited to 1 discount per order. If true and a customer pays for multiple items the coupon applies to, only the lowest priced item is discounted. Coupons with a `bookings` `namespace` are always limited to one item.

members.name: minimumSubtotal
members.doc: The coupon is only applicable when the order subtotal is over this amount.

members.name: moneyOffAmount
members.doc: Coupon type: Fixed price discount.

members.name: percentOffRate
members.doc: Coupon type: Discount as a percentage.

members.name: fixedPriceAmount
members.doc: Coupon type: Specific sale price. Currently only supported for coupons with a `stores` `namespace`.

members.name: buyXGetY
members.doc: Coupon type: Free products when making a purchase. `buyXGetY` is an object that specifies `x` and `y` in the following scenario: if a visitor purchases x number of products, they receive y number of products for free. Currently only supported for coupons with a `stores` `namespace`.

members.name: freeShipping
members.doc: Coupon type: Free shipping. If true, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces` in the site.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that created the coupon. Empty if created by the site owner.

members.name: numberOfUsages
members.doc: How many times the coupon was used.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the new coupon.

docs.summary: An object representing information for creating or updating a coupon.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of coupon.

members.name: code
members.doc: Coupon code. Must be unique for all coupons in your site. Maximum 20 characters.

members.name: startTime
members.doc: Coupon valid from this date and time.

members.name: expirationTime
members.doc: Coupon expires at this date and time.

members.name: usageLimit
members.doc: Maximum number of times a coupon can be used. Note that multiple purchases by the same customer or purchases by different customers are both counted toward usage limit.

members.name: limitedToOneItem
members.doc: Indicates whether the coupon is limited to 1 discount per order. If true and a customer pays for multiple items the coupon applies to, only the lowest priced item is discounted. Coupons with a `bookings` `namespace` are always limited to one item.

members.name: active
members.doc: Indicates whether the coupon is currently [active](https://support.wix.com/en/article/activating-and-deactivating-coupons-in-wix-stores).

members.name: minimumSubtotal
members.doc: The coupon is only applicable when the order subtotal is over this amount.

members.name: scope
members.doc: Scope of the coupon. When no scope is defined, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces` in the site.

members.name: moneyOffAmount
members.doc: Coupon type: Fixed price discount.

members.name: percentOffRate
members.doc: Coupon type: Discount as a percentage.

members.name: fixedPriceAmount
members.doc: Coupon type: Specific sale price. Currently only supported for coupons with a `stores` `namespace`.

members.name: buyXGetY
members.doc: Coupon type: Free products when making a purchase. `buyXGetY` is an object that specifies `x` and `y` in the following scenario: if a visitor purchases x number of products, they receive y number of products for free. Currently only supported for coupons with a `stores` `namespace`.

members.name: freeShipping
members.doc: Coupon type: Free shipping. If true, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces` in the site.

members.name: limitPerCustomer
members.doc: Maximum number of times the coupon can be used **per customer**. Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: appliesToSubscriptions
members.doc: Whether the coupon applies to subscription products.

members.name: discountedCycleCount
members.doc:
Specifies the amount of cycles to apply the discount to for a subscription item.  

Can only be set when `appliesToSubscriptions` is `TRUE` and `scope.namespace` is `pricingPlans`. 
If `discountedCycleCount` is empty, the coupon applies to all available cycles.  

Min: `1`  
Max: `999`

docs.summary: An object containing the scope of a coupon.

examples.title: Create a new coupon that applies to a specific store product
body: "scope": { // Coupon applies to the store product with the specified ID

examples.title: Create a new coupon that applies to all bookings services
body: "namespace": "bookings" // Coupon applies to all booking services

examples.title: Create a new coupon that applies to all event tickets
body: "scope": { // Coupon applies to all event tickets

members.name: namespace
members.doc:
Wix application for which the coupon is applicable.
One of the following:

 + `"stores"`
 + `"bookings"`
 + `"events"`
 + `"pricingPlans"`

members.name: group
members.doc: Group within a `namespace` for which the coupon is applicable. If no group is specified, the coupon applies to all items in the namespace. `group` is required in some cases. See the table in [`createCoupon()`](#createCoupon) for a list of currently supported groups for each namespace.

docs.summary: An object defining the number of purchases required and the number of free items received for a "Buy X Get Y" coupon type.

examples.title: Create a new "buy x, get y" coupon

members.name: x
members.doc: Number of purchased items required to receive free items.

members.name: y
members.doc: Number of items received for free if required number of items were purchased.

docs.summary: An object representing display data for the product associated with the coupon.

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name.

members.name: formattedPrice
members.doc: Formatted price for display.

members.name: mediaItem
members.doc: Media ID for the product associated with the coupon.

docs.summary:
An object specifying the group within a `CouponScope`
`namespace` for which the coupon is applicable.

examples.title: Create a new coupon that applies to a specific store product
body: "scope": { // Coupon applies to the store product with the specified ID

examples.title: Create a new coupon that applies to all bookings services
body: "namespace": "bookings" // Coupon applies to all booking services

examples.title: Create a new coupon that applies to all event tickets
body: "scope": { // Coupon applies to all event tickets

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the group.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the specific item in the group for which the coupon is applicable. If no `entityId` is specified, the coupon applies to all items in the group. In some cases when a group is specified, an `entityId` is required. See the table in [`createCoupon()`](#createCoupon) for a list of currently supported entities for each namespace and group.
